steps.title: Download virtual reality apps.
steps.content: Download virtual reality apps. There are a variety of VR apps available for iPhone and Android devices. Use the following steps to browse and download apps: [2] X Research source Open the Google Play Store on Android, or App Store on iPhone. Search "VR". Tap a VR app. Tap GET , or Install next to the app.

steps.title: Open the VR glasses headset.
steps.content: Open the VR glasses headset. Some VR headsets open from the front. Others have a tray that slides out from the side you use to mount your smartphone. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place your smartphone in the holding tray.
steps.content: Place your smartphone in the holding tray. Most VR headsets have a spring loaded mount to hold your phone. [4] X Research source Turn your phone sideways and slide it in to the mount. If you normally keep your smartphone in a protective case, you may need to remove your phone from its protective case before mounting it in the VR headset.

steps.title: Open a VR app.
steps.content: Open a VR app. Tap the icon for a VR app on your homescreen to open the app. If the VR app you want to play requires a game controller, be sure to open pair it using Bluetooth before opening the app.

steps.title: Align the screen in the center.
steps.content: Align the screen in the center. VR apps display two images separated by a line. Align the center-line with the marker on the mount, or the vision divider in the headset.

steps.title: Close the VR headset.
steps.content: Close the VR headset. With the app is playing, close the VR headset front, or slide the tray back into the headset.

steps.title: Place the VR headset on your head.
steps.content: Place the VR headset on your head. Place the display mount over the front of your eyes and pull the head-straps over the back of your head. Adjust the straps as needed so that the display mount is held firmly in place.

steps.title: Adjust the spacing of the lenses.
steps.content: Adjust the spacing of the lenses. Many VR headsets have the ability to adjust the horizontal spacing of the lenses. If you are able to adjust the lens spacing, adjust them so that the image is clear. Some headsets have a knob that you can turn, other require you to manually adjust the lens spacing. You only need to do this once.

steps.title: Adjust the focus.
steps.content: Adjust the focus. Most VR headsets have a way for you to adjust the focus. Some headsets have a knob that you can turn, other require you to manually move the lenses forwards and backwards, or adjust the distance of the phone from the lenses. [5] X Research source You only need to do this once.

steps.title: Use your head movements to control the cursor.
steps.content: Use your head movements to control the cursor. If you see a dot in the center of the screen, you can use the dot to interact with the VR content. Move the cursor with your head movements. To activate an icon or button, place the cursor over the icon and hold it there for a few seconds. So apps are view only and do not have a cursor. For these apps, you will need to start the app before placing your phone in the VR headset, and remove your phone to change something in the app, or change to a different app. Some VR apps require an external controller for VR. For these apps, you will need to connect the controller to your smartphone using Bluetooth. Consult the user's manual for your controller for more information.
